holidays.name: Scotch Tape Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to celebrating the invention and everyday magic of Scotch Tape! Without it, how would we fix torn pages, wrap gifts, or hold together last-minute projects?
holidays.origin: Scotch Tape was invented by Richard Drew in 1930 as a handy adhesive tape for household and office use.
holidays.funFact: Scotch Tape originally had a cloudy appearance, but the clear version that we love today was introduced later to make repairs less visible.

holidays.name: Lucky Penny Day
holidays.description: On this day, people celebrate the charm of finding a lucky penny! It's a reminder that sometimes small things bring unexpected good fortune.
holidays.origin: The tradition of finding a penny for luck dates back to ancient Europe, where copper was believed to ward off evil spirits.
holidays.funFact: Did you know that pennies made before 1982 are mostly copper, but newer ones are mostly zinc with just a copper coating?

holidays.name: International Tiara Day
holidays.description: A sparkling day to wear your tiara and embrace your inner royalty, queen, or crowned champion!
holidays.origin: An unofficial holiday created by tiara enthusiasts to spread joy, confidence, and a bit of sparkle.
